intro: Collomia grandiflora f. cryptantha, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and alpine meadows, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This subspecies is notable for its adaptation to high-altitude environments and its role in local ecosystems.
